No problem!

I can see that it will be tricky to make this work. No torque..

You could try probe cores for a chest? may look like ribs and will stablize it a bit.

It really is so adorable. Look! it wants a hug!

Oh, hang on a min! You used rescaled parts right? Just rescale some reaction wheels and use them to stabilize it.

Edited August 10, 2014 by Majorjim

No problem!

I can see that it will be tricky to make this work. No torque..

You could try probe cores for a chest? may look like ribs and will stablize it a bit.

It really is so adorable. Look! it wants a hug!

Oh, hang on a min! You used rescaled parts right? Just rescale some reaction wheels and use them to stabilize it.

you cant rescale reaction wheel, not jet atleast

you cant rescale reaction wheel, not jet atleast

Probe cores?

I got one to walk without reaction wheels using arms/body to move the CoM over each foot, can walk forward with just two action groups. A similar action for that small one may be the simplest you'll get, otherwise it looks like a nightmare of individual joint control to make him balance.

I got one to walk without reaction wheels using arms/body to move the CoM over each foot, can walk forward with just two action groups. A similar action for that small one may be the simplest you'll get, otherwise it looks like a nightmare of individual joint control to make him balance.

this is gonna take a little time to get some where.

but om my god that is so cool.

good work
This thing is seriously well done dude. I thought for a nono-second about making a mech suite as close to iron man as possible, but I figured it was impossible. This blows my mind

I found a good way for building walkers without asas. Take a look at my screenshots. It doesn't have sas and can walk, although I prefer to use wheels so it moves faster. Send me a PM if you want a craft file.
My Mech, copied from your exoskeleton idea really, is taking shape. Has no SAS/reaction wheels at all and walks with balance and a kOS script at the moment, I'll make a thread when its finished.

My Mech, copied from your exoskeleton idea really, is taking shape. Has no SAS/reaction wheels at all and walks with balance and a kOS script at the moment, I'll make a thread when its finished

good work darren.

rep +

Have you tried putting a SAS on it so that it keeps the thing vertical while you step?

Ah nevermind I just read the other posts

I would try to make an exoskeleton, i really like making walking things, but the problem is that IR doesn't work with 0.24 for some reason, it works but they can't be resized.

I would go for a mechanism instead of a script or a "press key X then X and then X to move half a meter"
That is the cutest exoskeleton I have ever seen, OP.
